publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3555 Alex Neil: Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women—That the Parliament notes that around 90% of those ex-servicemen and women who apply for compensation due to having suffered hearing loss because of their service are refused such compensation; calls on Her Majesty’s Government to reduce the threshold for compensation from its present level of 50 decibels to 35 decibels, in line with other countries such as the United States of America and the Republic of Ireland, and commends the Royal National Institute for Deaf People for its campaign on this issue.

S2M-3555 Alex Neil: Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women—That the Parliament notes that around 90% of those ex-servicemen and women who apply for compensation due to having suffered hearing loss because of their service are refused such compensation; calls on Her Majesty’s Government to reduce the threshold for compensation from its present level of 50 decibels to 35 decibels, in line with other countries such as the United States of America and the Republic of Ireland, and commends the Royal National Institute for Deaf People for its campaign on this issue.
S2M-3555 Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women (lodged on 10 November 2005) Fiona Hyslop*

S2M-3555 Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women (lodged on 10 November 2005) Campbell Martin*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr John Swinney*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Dr Jean Turner*, Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Brian Adam*, Rob Gibson*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Carolyn Leckie*, Ms Sandra White*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-3555 Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women (lodged on 10 November 2005) Robin Harper*, Stewart Stevenson*, Bruce Crawford*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-3555 Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women (lodged on 10 November 2005) Trish Godman*
S2M-3555 Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women (lodged on 10 November 2005) Shiona Baird*, Frances Curran*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-3555 Compensation for Hearing Loss for Ex-Servicemen and Women (lodged on 10 November 2005) Mrs Margaret Ewing*
